definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
variant of 編者按|编者按[bian1 zhe3 an4]

sentences.english: Glossary is provided by the editor.
Tang Dalie, the editor of this publication, is regarded as the first man to publish TCM journal.
sentences.chinese: 其編者唐大烈被認爲是中醫期刊編輯第一家。

sentences.english: An editor said he hopes the book "Wen Wen Er Ya" which literally means "gentle and cultivated" will arouse public interest in Chinese traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: 編者稱，希望該書能激發民衆對傳統文化的興趣。

sentences.english: This play has been skillfully adapted from the original novel.
sentences.chinese: 改編者很熟練地將原小說改編成一部戲劇。

sentences.english: The present compilers present this dictionary to the public.
sentences.chinese: 本編者謹以這部詞典獻給廣大讀者。

sentences.english: The writer lacks basic understanding of the business problem.
sentences.chinese: 編者缺乏對業務問題的基本理解。

sentences.english: Fourthly, the editor supplement the annotation where leaks the note or the annotations all inaccurate he thought in the book.
sentences.chinese: 漏注或認爲註文都不確切的地方，編者則作補註。

sentences.english: The authors believe it was probably caused by heat emanating from the optical drive.
sentences.chinese: 編者相信這應該是由於光驅散發的熱量。

sentences.english: After waiting for nine years, such a chance comes, thanks to the editors.
sentences.chinese: 等了九年，才又有這麼一次機會，謝謝選編者。

sentences.english: Very those who let me gasp in admiration is complier people the time that choosing language exemple nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 很讓我讚歎的是編者們在挑選語例時下的工夫。

sentences.english: Signifies the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the change of hand.
sentences.chinese: 指出負責確認書寫者改變的編者或轉錄者。

sentences.english: The editor has to edit any article down to the ground before its publication.
sentences.chinese: 在出刊前編者對每篇文章都會認真的審覈。

definition: marginal notes/annotation/to annotate/to add comments to text
guide (e.g. book or other printed material)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
